intro: Dicerma biarticulatum subsp. hispidum, commonly known as the hairy dicerma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its subspecific name "hispidum." The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive appearance. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
